content: o/c knitiot designs deby lake blue jean saturday asymmetrical shawl this one skein easy wear shawl will look beautiful with your favorite blue jeans on a saturday…… but honestly it will look great with anything on any day this pattern was designed for my friend dawn at the wooly cabin on etsy https //www etsy com/shop/thewoolycabin using her blue jean saturday sock yarn i used all but 40 of the 463-yard skein this is a very easy pattern to adjust in size quit whenever you want in the pattern or make it bigger with more yarn gauge 5sts per inch in garter stitch blocked size 77 x 17 at deepest point fingering weight yarn 463 yards fingering weight yarn model knit with the wooly cabin-blue jean saturday sock yarn size 6 4 0mm 24-32 circular needle key yo= yarn over k2tog=knit 2 stitches together kfb=knit into the front then the back of same stitch tbl=through back loop wyib=with yarn in back ©blue jean saturday this is a free pattern for personal use only please respect copyright o/c knitiot designs deby lake o/c knitiot designs deby lake cast on 5 stitches prep row row 1 rs k1 kfb k2tog k1tbl 5sts row 2 k3 kfb p1 6sts row 3 k1 kfb knit to last 3 stitches k2tog k1tbl row 4 knit to last 2 stitches kfb p1 repeat row 3 & 4 until you have 45sts on needle lace section note the lace section is knit in stocking stitch k right side p wrong side if you prefer to have the lace section in garter stitch just knit the wrong side row and purl the last stitch row 1 rs k1 kfb k2tog yo k2 repeat to last 3 stitches k2tog k1tbl row 2 4 6 8 ws knit 1 purl to last 2 stitches wyib kfb p1 row 3 k1 kfb k1 k2tog yo k2 repeat to last 3 stitches k2tog k1tbl row 5 k1 kfb k2 k2tog yo k2 repeat to last 3 stitches k2tog k1tbl row 7 k1 kfb k3 k2tog yo k2 repeat to last 3 stitches k2tog k1tbl repeat row 1-row 8 two more times 24 row 12 stitches added garter stitch section row 1 k1 kfb knit to last 3 stitches k2tog k1tbl row 2 knit to last 2 stitches kfb p1 repeat these 2 row 20 times 40 row 20 stitches added you will continue the shawl by alternating the lace and garter stitch sections with stitch counts as follows prep garter stitch section 45sts after completing 1st lace section 57sts after completing 2nd garter stitch section 77sts after completing 2nd lace section 89sts after completing 3rd garter stitch section 109sts after completing 3rd lace section 121sts after completing 4th garter stitch section 141sts after completing 4th lace section 153sts after completing notes i had 20gms left before starting the 4th lace section it took 15gms to finish this section ending note you will need 5gms to do the last 6 garter stitch row
